author: Anjana George
title: Sidharth Bharathan to work on a Mohanlal film
text:
Actor-director Sidharth Bharathan who is recovering from a serious injury after a car crash will be using his rest period to work on his next project. Reportedly, he is planning to rope in Mohanlal for the film.
A source close to Sidharth says, "Doctors have advised Sidharth to take rest for the next three months. Prior to the accident, we were working on a few scripts, aiming to rope in Mohanlal in the lead. We had also fixed a meeting with him. After his discharge from the hospital, we are going to work more on our ideas and will bring up something really interesting."
The actor was admitted in the hospital with severe head injury and thigh fracture on September 12, midnight, after his car met with an accident in Kochi. "Sidharth had a skull fracture and suffered internal and external bleeding. However, he responded quickly to the treatment and became stable in three days. Currently he only has difficulty walking, due to the thigh fracture. He will be perfectly alright in another six weeks," said the doctors treating
Sidharth gave his first public appearance after the accident along with his mother KPAC Lalitha on Thursday . Talking to media, he said, "I think God has blessed me in abundance or else I wouldn't be talking right now." His mother burst into tears and thanked her friends inside and outside cinema for all the support. "When I saw his face on the accident day, I thought he had left me. And I refrained from seeing him until the doctors told me that he recalled his name. And the moment he called me 'Amma', I realised that I had got my life back," she said.
